title: Welcome
text:
Welcome to my blog on football analytics.
I’m a Senior Data Scientist at CrowdStrike by day, building AI/ML systems for cybersecurity. By night and on weekends, I apply those same data science skills to my passion: football (soccer) analytics.
Here I’ll share technical write-ups, analysis, and insights from my work with tracking data, metrics development, and more.
Stay tuned for deep dives into projects like the Active Support Index (ASI) and other football analytics explorations.

title: Active Support Index (ASI)
text: A novel metric for quantifying off-ball movement during pressure situations, developed for the SkillCorner x PySport Analytics Cup (2025-2026).

title: Active Support Index (ASI)
text: A novel metric for quantifying off-ball movement during pressure situations, developed for the SkillCorner x PySport Analytics Cup (2025-2026).

title: Active Support Index (ASI)
text:
The Problem
When a teammate is under pressure, what makes good off-ball support? We intuitively know when teammates “show for the ball” vs. hide from it. But can we quantify it?

title: Active Support Index (ASI)
text:
The Solution
ASI measures how actively teammates support the ball carrier during pressure situations. It captures positioning, movement toward passing lanes, and availability as an outlet.

title: Active Support Index (ASI)
text:
Data

10 A-League 2024/25 matches
7,063 pressure events
8+ million tracking data points from SkillCorner

title: Active Support Index (ASI)
text:
Validation
ASI correlated strongly with physical performance metrics (r=0.74, p<0.001). Players who score higher on ASI tend to be the ones covering more ground and making themselves available. The metric appears to capture something real.
